bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Environmental Management Act;
placer mineral has the same meaning as in the Mineral Tenure Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person who carries out a class of operation, activity, industry or work referred to in section 3 is exempt from section 6 (2) and (3) of the Act in respect of that class if the person meets the conditions and circumstances set out in section 3 and provides to a director on the director's request information the director considers sufficient to determine the existence and extent of the discharge.
The classes of operations, activities, industries or works referred to in section 2 are discharges into the environment of waste from mining a placer mineral where the discharges are from

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: testing for the presence of placer minerals by means of equipment movable by hand where

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: neither mercury nor chemicals are used,
the diameter of the intake of a washwater delivery system does not exceed 38 mm,
tailings are discharged to a tailings pond with a minimum of 0.5 m freeboard, and
the water in the tailings pond

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is pumped back to the operation for reuse,
is left in the pond and allowed to seep into the ground in a manner which does not result in suspended solids entering a body of water at any point downstream of the operation, or
is partly pumped back as referred to in clause (A) and is partly left as referred to in clause (B), or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: neither mercury nor chemicals are used,
tailings are discharged to a tailings pond with a minimum of 0.5 m freeboard, and
the water in the tailings pond

bcl:clause.bcl:text: is pumped back to the operation for reuse,
is left in the pond and allowed to seep into the ground in a manner which does not result in suspended solids entering a body of water at any point downstream of the operation, or
is partly pumped back as referred to in clause (A) and is partly left as referred to in clause (B).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: This section applies to a person who is exempt from section 6 (2) and (3) of the Act in respect of discharges referred to in section 3 (c) (i) of this regulation as it read immediately before the coming into force of this section.

A person to whom this section applies, other than a person who is exempt from section 6 (2) and (3) of the Act in respect of discharges referred to in section 3 (c) of this regulation, as it reads after the coming into force of this section, is exempt from section 6 (2) and (3) of the Act in respect of discharges referred to in subsection (1) of this section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the person applies before January 1, 2022 to a director for a permit under section 14 of the Act in relation to the discharge, and
until the date a director makes a decision in relation to the person’s permit application.
